newsitem.title: USA: CE Software trims workforce by 17 percent.
newsitem.headline: CE Software trims workforce by 17 percent.

text.p: CE Software Holdings Inc said Wednesday it reduced its workforce by 17 percent, eliminating 16 positions.

"CE Software is streamlining operations and cutting costs in order to focus on continuous improvement of our proucts," Richard Skeie, president, said in a statement. "We remain confident in our messaging product direction, which includes developing our products for Microsoft's (Corp) Windows computing environments."
CE Software develops electronic mail for local area network-based systems and the Internet, and other software.

Earlier, CE Software reported a net loss for the fiscal first quarter ended December 31 of $0.07 a share, compared with $0.02 a year ago. Sales for the quarter declined to $2.0 million from $2.7 million.

"A relatively weak computer software market and confusion about the future of Apple Computer (Inc) were factors in the quarter's revenues," Richard Skeie, president of CE Software, said in a statement.
On Tuesday, Apple said it would consolidate operations to focus on its core businesses.
Additionally, Skeie said, CE Software's new Internet E-mail product, QuickMail Pro, released in November, is still in the early stages of marketing.
Separately, CE Software said its Net Target Inc affiliate secured capital from a venture capital firm.
The amount of the capital and the name of the venture capital firm were not immediately known. A CE Software spokesman was not immediately available.

CE Software was a founder and investor in Net Target, incorporated in October 1996. CE Software's ownership of Net Target after the venture funding is approximately 22 percent. The new company was valued at $7.25 million.
